meta-tags.title: Favorite Homemade Granola Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Beautifully crisp and lightly sweetened, this granola is loaded with oats, almonds, coconut, pecans, dried cherries, and cinnamon. Start here, or change it up using any of the suggested options to create your own house granola. Either way, be sure to bake it low and slow at 300°F for the best texture. And be sure to wait until the granola comes out of the oven to add any dried fruit; otherwise, it will get hard and stick to your teeth! The recipe, which makes 10 cups, is a Yummly original created by [Annalise Sandberg](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/annalise-sandberg).

firebase.description: Beautifully crisp and lightly sweetened, this granola is loaded with oats, almonds, coconut, pecans, dried cherries, and cinnamon. Start here, or change it up using any of the suggested options to create your own house granola. Either way, be sure to bake it low and slow at 300°F for the best texture. And be sure to wait until the granola comes out of the oven to add any dried fruit; otherwise, it will get hard and stick to your teeth! The recipe, which makes 10 cups, is a Yummly original created by [Annalise Sandberg](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/annalise-sandberg).

description.text: Beautifully crisp and lightly sweetened, this granola is loaded with oats, almonds, coconut, pecans, dried cherries, and cinnamon. Start here, or change it up using any of the suggested options to create your own house granola. Either way, be sure to bake it low and slow at 300°F for the best texture. And be sure to wait until the granola comes out of the oven to add any dried fruit; otherwise, it will get hard and stick to your teeth! The recipe, which makes 10 cups, is a Yummly original created by [Annalise Sandberg](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/annalise-sandberg).

preparationSteps: Preheat oven to 300°F and line a sheet pan with parchment paper.

In a small saucepan, combine olive oil, honey, cinnamon, salt, and vanilla. Warm over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until mixture is smooth, 2-3 minutes. (If using butter, coconut oil, or brown sugar, ingredients should be fully melted and dissolved). Remove from heat.
In a large bowl, combine oats, almonds, coconut, and pecans. Pour liquid ingredients over oats mixture and stir until dry ingredients are uniformly coated.
Pour out mixture onto the prepared sheet pan and use a spatula or wooden spoon to spread it into a flat, even layer.
Bake until granola just starts to turn golden brown, 20-25 minutes. Remove from oven, stir mixture thoroughly, then spread it back into an even layer.
Bake until granola is fully deep golden brown, 20-25 minutes more, keeping an eye on the edges so they don’t start to burn.
If using dried cherries or other dried fruit, immediately press them into the top of the granola as soon as it comes out of the oven, but do not stir.

Set granola on a wire rack and let it cool in the pan completely, about 45 minutes, then use your hands to break it up into clusters. Store granola in an airtight container at room temperature up to 2 weeks, or freeze airtight up to 2 months.

description.text: When making dressing from scratch, the knife prep is what takes the most time. When you do it with your [KitchenAid® K400 Blender](https://yummly.app.link/riAWRIPkd1), however, prep almost goes away and clean up is a snap. preparationSteps: Add the lime juice, soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, honey, fish sauce, ginger and garlic to your KitchenAid® K400 Blender. Turn the blender to ice crush and allow to run through the cycle. Open the lid cap and add the quartered shallot and half of the grapeseed oil. Replace the lid cap and pulse four times. Open the lid cap again and add the remaining grapeseed oil. Replace the lid cap and pulse another four times.
Store in an airtight container with a tight fitting lid, and shake well before serving.

meta-tags.description: Looking for a quick weeknight fix? This Asian-inspired chicken thigh recipe is ready in 30 minutes and requires only 5 ingredients. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Edwina Clark, RDN](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/edwina-clark-rdn).

firebase.name: 30-Minute Asian Chicken Thighs Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Looking for a quick weeknight fix? This Asian-inspired chicken thigh recipe is ready in 30 minutes and requires only 5 ingredients. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Edwina Clark, RDN](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/edwina-clark-rdn).

description.text: Looking for a quick weeknight fix? This Asian-inspired chicken thigh recipe is ready in 30 minutes and requires only 5 ingredients. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Edwina Clark, RDN](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/edwina-clark-rdn).

preparationSteps: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Spray liberally with nonstick cooking spray.
Crush and finely mince the garlic.
Combine the garlic, honey, and soy sauce in a medium mixing bowl. Whisk until well mixed.
Add the chicken thighs to the bowl and toss to coat in the honey-soy mixture. Transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Pour any remaining honey-soy mixture over the tops of the chicken thighs.
Bake on middle rack of oven until the thickest part of the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°F, about 20 minutes.
Check to see that chicken is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow the chicken thighs to rest for 5 minutes before serving.

firebase.name: Asian Sesame Roasted Broccoli Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Slightly salty, slightly sweet, this soy and sesame roasted broccoli is addictive! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: Slightly salty, slightly sweet, this soy and sesame roasted broccoli is addictive! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.

Make sure the broccoli florets are roughly 1 inch wide, and place them in a large mixing bowl. Sprinkle with the tamari, sesame oil, brown sugar, and crushed red pepper (if using). Toss until the florets are evenly coated.
Arrange the broccoli florets in an even layer on the baking sheet.
Roast on middle rack of oven, stirring halfway through the cook time, until broccoli is crisp-tender and slightly charred, 22-25 minutes.
Check to see that broccoli is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Sprinkle the florets with sesame seeds, and serve immediately.

meta-tags.title: Asian Baked Chicken Legs Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

firebase.name: Asian Baked Chicken Legs Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Place the tamari, brown sugar, honey, rice wine vinegar, and sesame oil in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Seal the bag and shake vigorously to combine.
Add the smashed garlic, chopped ginger, and chicken legs to the bag. Seal bag and gently shake to thoroughly coat chicken in marinade.
Transfer the chicken legs to refrigerator to marinate for at least 1 hour and up to 12 hours.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Spray with nonstick cooking spray, and set aside.
Using tongs, arrange the chicken legs on the baking sheet, allowing excess marinade to drip off into the bag.
Roast the chicken legs on middle rack of oven until slightly brown, 20-30 minutes.
Set oven to broil. Broil the chicken until skin is caramelized and chicken has reached an internal temperature of 165°F, 3-5 minutes. Keep a close eye on chicken to ensure it does not burn.
Check to see that chicken is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Transfer chicken legs to a plate and sprinkle with sesame seeds and chopped scallions, if desired. Serve immediately.

meta-tags.title: Sweet Asian Sticky Wings Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

firebase.name: Sweet Asian Sticky Wings Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil and place a roasting rack on top. Cover the rack with another sheet of foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Use a knife to poke holes all over the foil.
Pat the chicken wings dry with paper towels. Place the chicken wings in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Sprinkle in the baking powder. Seal the bag and shake until the wings are evenly coated.
Drizzle the canola oil into the bag of chicken wings. Seal the bag and shake again to coat the chicken wings in oil.
Arrange the chicken wings on the foil-covered roasting rack.
Bake the chicken wings on middle rack of oven until browned and crispy, 45-50 minutes. While the wings bake, make the sauce.
Place the water, soy sauce, honey, brown sugar, rice vinegar, fish sauce, and toasted sesame oil in a small saucepan. Grate or press the garlic and ginger into the pan.

Set the pan over medium heat and bring to a low boil. Allow the mixture to bubble, whisking occasionally, until it is reduced to about 1/2 cup, 5-7 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and set aside. The sauce will thicken slightly as it cools.
Finely chop the scallion.
Check to see that chicken wings are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed. Drizzle the sauce liberally over the hot chicken wings, reserving about half for serving.
Transfer the wings to a serving plate. Garnish with scallions, and serve immediately with the reserved sauce on the side.

firebase.name: Asian Baked Chicken Legs Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: A sweet soy, garlic, and sesame marinade imparts big flavor in these easy-to-make chicken legs. For more flavorful wings, plan for up to 12 hours of marinating time. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Place the tamari, brown sugar, honey, rice wine vinegar, and sesame oil in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Seal the bag and shake vigorously to combine.
Add the smashed garlic, chopped ginger, and chicken legs to the bag. Seal bag and gently shake to thoroughly coat chicken in marinade.
Transfer the chicken legs to refrigerator to marinate for at least 1 hour and up to 12 hours.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Spray with nonstick cooking spray, and set aside.
Using tongs, arrange the chicken legs on the baking sheet, allowing excess marinade to drip off into the bag.
Roast the chicken legs on middle rack of oven until slightly brown, 20-30 minutes.
Set oven to broil. Broil the chicken until skin is caramelized and chicken has reached an internal temperature of 165°F, 3-5 minutes. Keep a close eye on chicken to ensure it does not burn.
Check to see that chicken is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Transfer chicken legs to a plate and sprinkle with sesame seeds and chopped scallions, if desired. Serve immediately.

meta-tags.title: Sweet Asian Sticky Wings Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

firebase.name: Sweet Asian Sticky Wings Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

description.text: Drizzled in a sticky-sweet soy sauce glaze, it's nearly impossible to stop eating these crispy wings! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).

preparationSteps: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil and place a roasting rack on top. Cover the rack with another sheet of foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Use a knife to poke holes all over the foil.
Pat the chicken wings dry with paper towels. Place the chicken wings in a gallon-sized zip-top bag. Sprinkle in the baking powder. Seal the bag and shake until the wings are evenly coated.
Drizzle the canola oil into the bag of chicken wings. Seal the bag and shake again to coat the chicken wings in oil.
Arrange the chicken wings on the foil-covered roasting rack.
Bake the chicken wings on middle rack of oven until browned and crispy, 45-50 minutes. While the wings bake, make the sauce.
Place the water, soy sauce, honey, brown sugar, rice vinegar, fish sauce, and toasted sesame oil in a small saucepan. Grate or press the garlic and ginger into the pan.

Set the pan over medium heat and bring to a low boil. Allow the mixture to bubble, whisking occasionally, until it is reduced to about 1/2 cup, 5-7 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and set aside. The sauce will thicken slightly as it cools.
Finely chop the scallion.
Check to see that chicken wings are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed. Drizzle the sauce liberally over the hot chicken wings, reserving about half for serving.
Transfer the wings to a serving plate. Garnish with scallions, and serve immediately with the reserved sauce on the side.

meta-tags.title: Braised Turkey Legs With Roasted Garlic Gravy Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: For many, it’s simply not Thanksgiving without turkey. But let’s face it: Whole turkeys are expensive. Those looking for a cheaper alternative should consider roasting whole turkey legs. Since they’re nice and meaty, you’ll need a smaller total amount. And while whole-roasted turkeys often leave the darker meat of the drumsticks and thighs a bit tough, this low-and-slow braise yields meat so juicy and tender it basically falls off the bone. You’ll dry-brine the legs overnight, which is just rubbing them in a simple mixture of salt, pepper, and brown sugar. Then sear on the stove to nail that delightful golden brown color. Deglaze the pan with a bit of water and vinegar for a super-flavorful braising liquid, and transfer to a roasting pan in the oven with garlic and onions to slowly braise. When the turkey’s done, turn the garlic and pan drippings into a delicious, mellow gravy. After a bite, you may never want to roast a whole turkey again. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Rebecca Firkser](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/rebecca-firkser).

description.text: For many, it’s simply not Thanksgiving without turkey. But let’s face it: Whole turkeys are expensive. Those looking for a cheaper alternative should consider roasting whole turkey legs. Since they’re nice and meaty, you’ll need a smaller total amount. And while whole-roasted turkeys often leave the darker meat of the drumsticks and thighs a bit tough, this low-and-slow braise yields meat so juicy and tender it basically falls off the bone. You’ll dry-brine the legs overnight, which is just rubbing them in a simple mixture of salt, pepper, and brown sugar. Then sear on the stove to nail that delightful golden brown color. Deglaze the pan with a bit of water and vinegar for a super-flavorful braising liquid, and transfer to a roasting pan in the oven with garlic and onions to slowly braise. When the turkey’s done, turn the garlic and pan drippings into a delicious, mellow gravy. After a bite, you may never want to roast a whole turkey again. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Rebecca Firkser](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/rebecca-firkser).

preparationSteps: Brine turkey: Strip leaves from thyme sprigs, if using, and coarsely chop. In a small bowl, use your fingers to combine salt, brown sugar, pepper, and thyme. Pat turkey legs dry with paper towels and place on a sheet pan. Rub salt mixture all over the legs. Refrigerate turkey, uncovered, for at least 4 hours and up to 24 hours. When you’re ready to cook, remove the legs from the refrigerator and pat dry (no need to wash off any excess dry brine).
Preheat oven to 300ºF.

Braise turkey: Heat 2 Tbsp. oil in a large, deep frying pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 turkey legs, skin-side down, and sear until skin is deeply golden and releases easily from the pan, 4-6 minutes. Place turkey, skin-side up, in a large roasting pan or 2 (9x13-inch) baking dishes. Add 2 Tbsp. more oil to the pan and repeat searing with remaining turkey legs in two batches, adding another Tbsp. oil if the pan seems dry, then nestling each seared leg into the roasting pan. (If using separate drumsticks and thighs, you should be able to sear all 3 drumsticks together, turning every 2 minutes, and thighs together or individually, depending on size). Save fat in frying pan.
Meanwhile, halve onions through the root end (no need to peel) and halve heads of garlic crosswise.
With frying pan with fat still at medium-high heat, place onions cut-side down in pan and sear until golden, 2-4 minutes. Nestle onions and halved garlic heads into the roasting pan.

Pour water and 3 Tbsp. vinegar into the frying pan and deglaze the pan, scraping up any browned bits stuck to the bottom. Pour deglazing liquid into roasting pan, or divide it between baking dishes. Cover roasting pan tightly with aluminum foil.

Place roasting pan in the oven and braise until turkey is incredibly tender and the meat shreds a bit when pulled at with a fork, about 2 1/2 hours. (If cooking separate drumsticks and thighs, the drumsticks may be done by 1 1/2 hours. They can stay in the oven or you can remove them to a plate and cover with foil while the thighs finish.) Note that the braised turkey will always reach or exceed a food-safe temperature, but won't turn out dry.

Remove pan from oven. Transfer turkey legs to a sheet pan and cover with foil to keep warm. (Or put pan of turkey in a 200°F oven for 1-2 hours before carving and serving.) Transfer garlic from roasting pan to a cutting board and transfer onions to a plate.

Make gravy: Pour juices left in the roasting pan into a heatproof measuring cup. Skim and discard fat. You should have 4 cups broth; save any extra for another use, or add water if need to make 4 cups. Set broth aside.

Squeeze garlic out of its skins onto the cutting board. Use the flat side of a chef’s knife to smash it a few times until smooth. Heat butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat until melted and starting to foam. Whisk in flour and continue to cook until the mixture smells nutty and turns the color of a latte, 4-5 minutes. Whisk in roasted garlic.

Slowly whisk in reserved 4 cups braising liquid. Increase heat to medium-high and bring mixture to an active simmer. Continue to cook, whisking occasionally and reducing heat if needed, until gravy is reduced to about 3 cups and is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, about 20 minutes. Stir in remaining 1 Tbsp. vinegar and season gravy with salt to taste. Transfer gravy to a serving bowl, straining it through a fine mesh sieve if you’d like it to be super-silky, and cover to keep warm.

On a cutting board, separate turkey thighs and drumsticks, if needed. Cut out bones from turkey thighs, slice meat crosswise, and arrange on a platter with drumsticks and reserved onions. Garnish platter with more fresh thyme if you like. Serve with gravy.

meta-tags.title: Tropical Grilled Chicken Breasts Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Creamy coconut, sweet orange, and plenty of tangy, fresh lime come together in this bright, tropical dish. The coconut-citrus mixture serves as both marinade and sauce; for the most flavor, marinate the meat for 2 hours. At serving time, feel free to leave the wedges of orange and lime as they are, or throw them on the grill with the chicken to add a little smoky char. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).

firebase.name: Tropical Grilled Chicken Breasts Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Creamy coconut, sweet orange, and plenty of tangy, fresh lime come together in this bright, tropical dish. The coconut-citrus mixture serves as both marinade and sauce; for the most flavor, marinate the meat for 2 hours. At serving time, feel free to leave the wedges of orange and lime as they are, or throw them on the grill with the chicken to add a little smoky char. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).

description.text: Creamy coconut, sweet orange, and plenty of tangy, fresh lime come together in this bright, tropical dish. The coconut-citrus mixture serves as both marinade and sauce; for the most flavor, marinate the meat for 2 hours. At serving time, feel free to leave the wedges of orange and lime as they are, or throw them on the grill with the chicken to add a little smoky char. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).

preparationSteps: Mince garlic. In a medium bowl, whisk together garlic, coconut cream, lime zest, lime juice, orange zest, orange juice, brown sugar, chopped cilantro, red pepper flakes, and 1 tsp. salt. Spoon out 1 cup, transfer it to a small saucepan, and set aside.
Add chicken to the bowl with the remaining coconut cream mixture and turn to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator at least 30 minutes and up to 2 hours.

Meanwhile, add cornstarch to the coconut mixture in the saucepan and whisk to blend. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring often, until sauce bubbles and thickens, about 2 minutes. Season with 1/4 tsp. salt and set sauce aside.
Cut orange into quarters and limes in half. Set aside.
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat (400° to 450°F). Drain and discard marinade from chicken. Sprinkle chicken with remaining 1/2 tsp. salt.

Grill chicken, covered with the grill lid and turning it halfway through cooking, until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest portion reaches 160°F, 10-12 minutes total. If you’ll be grilling the reserved oranges and limes, set them on the grill during the last few minutes of cooking, turning them once or twice, until they’re blackened on the flesh sides, about 2 minutes total. (Or serve the oranges and limes raw.)
Arrange chicken, orange, and limes on a platter and let chicken rest about 5 minutes. Reheat reserved sauce to serve alongside. Garnish chicken with cilantro sprigs.

meta-tags.title: Vietnamese Pork Noodle Bowls Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Salty, sour, sweet, and tangy — that’s what you’re in for with these Vietnamese pork noodle bowls. This quick main dish is a “choose your own adventure” recipe. Everyone can pick the toppings they like, including fresh vegetables and herbs and tangy-sweet nuoc cham sauce, so the whole family is happy. If you’re out of noodles, it’s great over rice, too. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).

description.text: Salty, sour, sweet, and tangy — that’s what you’re in for with these Vietnamese pork noodle bowls. This quick main dish is a “choose your own adventure” recipe. Everyone can pick the toppings they like, including fresh vegetables and herbs and tangy-sweet nuoc cham sauce, so the whole family is happy. If you’re out of noodles, it’s great over rice, too. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).

preparationSteps: Cook rice noodles according to package directions, then set aside.

Meanwhile, mince garlic. In a small bowl, stir together garlic, 1/3 cup water, 1/3 cup brown sugar, the soy sauce, 1 Tbsp. fish sauce, and the cornstarch. Set garlic sauce aside. Cut pork tenderloin into 1/4-inch-thick slices and set aside.
Make nuoc cham: In another small bowl, stir together lime juice, remaining 1/4 cup brown sugar and 2 1/2 Tbsp. fish sauce, the red pepper flakes, and remaining 1/3 cup water. Set aside.
Prepare toppings: Slice cucumber. Cut lime into wedges. Cut lettuce into shreds. Separate mint and basil leaves from stems. Set out toppings on a platter with shredded carrots.

Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add half the pork or less if needed so it’s in a single, uncrowded layer. Brown on each side, turning once, 3-4 minutes total. Transfer pork slices to a plate as they finish cooking to keep them from drying out. Repeat with remaining oil and pork, transferring meat to the plate.
Add reserved garlic sauce to the frying pan and cook, stirring often, until thickened, 1-2 minutes. Remove pan from heat and add pork, turning pieces in sauce to coat.
Divide noodles among serving bowls, then add pork. Scrape any remaining sauce from the pan onto the pork slices. Add toppings as you like and serve with nuoc cham to spoon on top.

meta-tags.title: Skillet Tuscan Chicken Mac and Cheese Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: If your idea of the perfect comfort food is a creative spin on a classic, you’ve landed at the right place. Picture a creamy, cheesy stovetop mac 'n' with the addition of juicy chicken, herbs, garlic, sauteed mushrooms and onion, roasted peppers, and sun-dried tomatoes. It’s an adventurous yet crowd-pleasing meal that all comes together in one pan. The recipe, which makes 9 cups, is a Yummly original created by [The Electrified Cooks](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/the-electrified-cooks).

description.text: If your idea of the perfect comfort food is a creative spin on a classic, you’ve landed at the right place. Picture a creamy, cheesy stovetop mac 'n' with the addition of juicy chicken, herbs, garlic, sauteed mushrooms and onion, roasted peppers, and sun-dried tomatoes. It’s an adventurous yet crowd-pleasing meal that all comes together in one pan. The recipe, which makes 9 cups, is a Yummly original created by [The Electrified Cooks](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/the-electrified-cooks).

preparationSteps: Chop onion. Trim any tough ends from mushrooms, then slice. Mince garlic. Chop roasted red peppers. Drain sun-dried tomatoes, reserving 1 Tbsp. oil. Set vegetables aside. Cut chicken into 3/4-inch chunks.

Heat olive oil in a large frying pan (at least 11 inches wide) over medium-high heat. Add chicken and season with salt, pepper, and paprika. Cook, stirring often, until chicken begins to brown and is cooked through, 5-6 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer chicken to a bowl, leaving drippings in pan. Set chicken aside.

Add mushrooms to frying pan and cook, stirring frequently until mushrooms are lightly browned and any liquid has cooked away, 6-8 minutes. Add onion and continue to cook, stirring often, until onion is tender, 3-5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Now stir in the roasted red peppers, sun-dried tomatoes and their reserved oil, Italian seasoning, and 2 1/2 cups chicken broth. Heat until broth just begins to boil. Stir in macaroni. Reduce heat to medium to maintain a boil. Cook uncovered, stirring frequently, until macaroni is tender, 8-10 minutes.

Reduce heat to low. Stir in 1/2 cup half-and-half and the Italian cheese blend and continue to stir until cheese melts. The sauce should be smooth and velvety. If it’s too thick or the cheese looks stringy, stir in 1/4 cup each of additional chicken broth and half-and-half.
Add cooked chicken, spinach, 3 Tbsp. basil, and the parsley. Gently stir until spinach is wilted and chicken is heated through, 2-3 minutes. Sprinkle with Parmesan and remaining 1 Tbsp. basil.

meta-tags.description: Daniel channels his inner Picasso while preparing the king of Italian steaks. Join him to see how to make beautiful grill marks, check for the perfect doneness, and carve a T-bone steak with ease.

firebase.name: Bistecca alla Fiorentina Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Daniel channels his inner Picasso while preparing the king of Italian steaks. Join him to see how to make beautiful grill marks, check for the perfect doneness, and carve a T-bone steak with ease.

description.text: Daniel channels his inner Picasso while preparing the king of Italian steaks. Join him to see how to make beautiful grill marks, check for the perfect doneness, and carve a T-bone steak with ease.

pro.display-name: recipe is available only for pro users

preparationSteps: An introduction to Bistecca alla Fiorentina with Daniel Holzman (Click on this step or "Make It Now" to view introduction.)
Season the steak with salt on all sides and let sit 15 minutes at room temperature.
Heat grill pan or grill (gas or charcoal) to high heat.
Use the rosemary to brush the steak on all sides with olive oil.
Grill for about 10-12 minutes on the first side. Cook the steak on the bone side for 1 minute and then flip steak and grill for about 8-12 minutes on the back side, until medium-rare.

Cut lemons in half and lightly coat the flesh with olive oil before placing on grill pan for 5 minutes. Flip the steak on remaining skin sides for about 1 minute each or until each side is crispy. Remove steak and lemons from grill.

Upon removing from the grill, allow steak to rest for 15 minutes before carving. Carve the steak, add sea salt, and serve with baby arugula on the side, and a small amount of olive oil for drizzling over the steak and arugula.

Grill for about 10-12 minutes on the first side. Cook the steak on the bone side for 1 minute and then flip steak and grill for about 8-12 minutes on the back side, until medium-rare.

Cut lemons in half and lightly coat the flesh with olive oil before placing on grill pan for 5 minutes. Flip the steak on remaining skin sides for about 1 minute each or until each side is crispy. Remove steak and lemons from grill.

Upon removing from the grill, allow steak to rest for 15 minutes before carving. Carve the steak, add sea salt, and serve with baby arugula on the side, and a small amount of olive oil for drizzling over the steak and arugula.

firebase.description: The best holiday recipes are quick AND impressive — like these savory broiled lamb chops that cook up in under 10 minutes thanks to high heat in the oven.

description.text: The best holiday recipes are quick AND impressive — like these savory broiled lamb chops that cook up in under 10 minutes thanks to high heat in the oven.

pro.display-name: recipe is available only for pro users

preparationSteps: An introduction to Rosemary and Clove Lamb Chops with Ali Rosen (Click on this step or "Make It Now" to view introduction.)
Set an oven rack at the highest position. Preheat the broiler to the highest temperature available (550°F if possible). Line a sheet pan with foil.
Strip the leaves from the rosemary springs and finely chop the leaves.
Combine the mayonnaise, chopped rosemary, cloves, and salt in a small bowl and stir to combine. Spread a thin layer of the seasoned mayonnaise on all sides of the lamb chops.
Transfer the lamb chops to the foil-lined sheet pan and broil until the chops are just beginning to brown on top, about 3 minutes.
Remove sheet pan from oven and flip each lamb chop over. Return pan to the oven and continue roasting until the other side begins to brown, about 3 minutes for medium rare.
Check to see that the lamb chops are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Transfer lamb chops to a serving platter, garnish with a rosemary sprig, and serve hot.

meta-tags.title: Avocado Gazpacho Recipe | Yummly
meta-tags.description: Last minute guests? The Potash twins have a simple but sophisticated recipe for that. Chop, blend, and chill your way to a refreshing gazpacho, and get plating tips to really wow your friends.

firebase.name: Avocado Gazpacho Recipe | Yummly
firebase.description: Last minute guests? The Potash twins have a simple but sophisticated recipe for that. Chop, blend, and chill your way to a refreshing gazpacho, and get plating tips to really wow your friends.

description.text: Last minute guests? The Potash twins have a simple but sophisticated recipe for that. Chop, blend, and chill your way to a refreshing gazpacho, and get plating tips to really wow your friends.

pro.display-name: recipe is available only for pro users

preparationSteps: An introduction to Avocado Gazpacho with the Potash Twins (Click on this step or "Make It Now" to view introduction.)

Peel the cucumbers. Halve the avocados, remove the pits, scoop out the flesh and roughly chop. Transfer to a blender. Thickly slice the cucumbers and add to blender. Season with salt and pepper. Smash, peel, and chop the garlic clove. Chop the shallot and add to the blender along with the garlic, olive oil, and yogurt.
Roll the lime on the cutting board, pressing firmly. Halve the lime and squeeze juice into the blender. Add the mint, parsley, and olive oil and cover.
Blend the soup until smooth. Check the gazpacho for consistency and seasoning, and add salt and pepper if needed. Refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour.

Prepare the garnishes: Halve and pit the avocado, then score and spoon out the flesh. Finely chop half of the cucumber. Quarter the cherry tomatoes. Spear each radish on a fork, and thinly slice radishes and the remaining cucumber using a mandoline. Thinly slice some of the hot red chile. Thinly slice the green portion of the green onion. Season all of the garnishes with salt.
Scatter desired garnishes into bottoms of bowls and pour soup on top. Add additional garnishes on top as desired. Sprinkle with fresh mint leaves, and drizzle with olive oil.
Serve and enjoy.
